content: Yes, it's one of the unique features of the platypus. The venom is not lethal to humans, but it can cause severe pain and swelling. The venom is used primarily for defense, and only male platypuses have venomous spurs. The spur is retractable and is located on the heel of the hind leg. When threatened, the platypus will kick with its powerful hind legs, delivering a venomous blow to its attacker.
